Topic.Title: Chechen Islamist brothers were the Boston bombers

Message.Msg: I would argue the opposite. Woman's right to choose is artificially made up, wide spread, recent concept. Impregnated woman usually carried her fetus up till birth for thousands of years. In fact, for centuries religious view on abortion was as sinful act, and most countries in the world came through theocracy, or later largely influenced and driven by basic religious concepts. Infanticide used to be the worst form of abortion, and even punished. You can argue that "simple humanity" is a recent concept. But it doesn't change the fact that abortions were never welcomed in the old past. My last point was that defining pro-choice as "universally accepted" is softly speaking overstatement. To the original point of abortion clinic shooting defined as terrorism. We know as much today about development of the fetus in mother's womb to come to conclusion that unborn on fairly early phase of development is not just a thing at women's personal disposal. In the minds of millions it is already a human. Defending the life of a human is Christian concept, some people chose creepy ways to do that. I would argue in some cases mental instability is the factor. But I disagree, abortion clinic killers don't do that for the sake of simply making a statement. That's a whole a world of difference with terrorism.
